sources.title: 1976 - Shout at the Devil - An unforgettable adventure and a love story for all time.
sources.description:
Treachery on the high seas! A rogue duo races against empires in WWI Africa.
In 1913 East Africa, roguish ivory poacher Flynn O'Flynn and disgraced British aristocrat Sebastian Oldsmith plot an audacious scam. When World War I erupts, they pivot to sabotage a German warship‚Äîunleashing explosive chaos across land and sea.

metadata.Plot: Just before World War I, the hard-drinking, sharpshooting, Irish-American Colonel Flynn O'Flynn uses British aristocrat Sebastian Oldsmith to help poach ivory from German-controlled territory in East Africa, putting them at odds with Herman Fleischer, the local German Provincial Commander. When Sebastian is infected with malaria, he is nursed back to health by Flynn's daughter Rosa, and they fall in love and marry. Not long afterwards, Britain declares war on Germany and they are drawn into the conflict, ultimately making a daring attack on the German armored cruiser S.M.S. Bl√ºcher as it undergoes repairs in a local estuary.
metadata.Writer: Stanley Price, Alastair Reid, Wilbur Smith
metadata.Actors: Lee Marvin, Roger Moore, Barbara Parkins
